ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:0.5_0: 14. The second training rule on loud noises
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were noisy while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not be noisy while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.4_0: he should not be noisy while sitting in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes loud noises while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.9_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
